item.title: Dominic Raab: With hindsight I wouldn't have gone on holiday
item.description: But the foreign secretary says the idea he was "lounging on the beach" as the Taliban advanced was "nonsense".

item.title: Unite union elects Sharon Graham as first woman leader
item.description: Sharon Graham replaces Len McCluskey, and vows to focus on workers' rights rather than Westminster politics.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban must allow evacuees after 31 August - Boris Johnson
item.description: The UK will continue evacuating people from Afghanistan "until the last moment", Boris Johnson says.

item.title: UK companies 'perform better' with overseas owners
item.description: Lord Grimstone says Britain should not pull down the shutters on the flood of overseas takeover bids.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK offers to help evacuate rescue animals and staff
item.description: Ben Wallace says the charity's plane will be found a slot so staff and animals can leave Afghanistan.

item.title: Lib Dem leader Ed Davey wants to target Tory heartlands
item.description: Smashing Tory dominance in the party's traditional areas is Liberal Democrats leader Ed Davey's plan. Can it work?

item.title: Consultation begins on beaver reintroductions
item.description: The UK government is seeking people's views on whether beavers should return to England's rivers.

item.title: Climate change: Consumer 'confusion' threatens net zero homes plan
item.description: Plans to decarbonise homes are too complicated and confusing, say consumer and industry groups.

item.title: Minister's wife goes ahead with legal action over nursery 'discrimination'
item.description: A nursery denies claims it discriminated against Humza Yousaf's wife and two-year-old daughter.

item.title: Extension of Afghanistan evacuation deadline unlikely, says Wallace
item.description: Any extension of the 31 August evacuation deadline would be a "big bonus", the defence secretary says.

item.title: Universal credit: Labour promises shake-up to benefit
item.description: The party says it would allow low income workers on universal credit to keep more of their take-home pay.

item.title: Social care charges: Disabled and vulnerable adults hit by steep rises
item.description: Many are facing a significant rise in the money they have to pay towards the support they receive.

item.title: Scotland hospital car parking charges to be scrapped
item.description: The Scottish government has struck deals worth Â£35m to buy out the car parks at Ninewells Hospital and Glasgow Royal Infirmary.

item.title: Afghanistan: Tony Blair says withdrawal was driven by imbecilic slogan
item.description: The ex-PM criticises the US decision to withdraw its military as "tragic, dangerous, and unnecessary".

item.title: SNP-Greens deal pledges indyref2 within five years
item.description: The agreement will take the Greens into government for the first time anywhere in the UK.

item.title: Afghanistan: PM to press Biden to delay Kabul withdrawal
item.description: Boris Johnson will request more time to evacuate people during a G7 meeting on Tuesday.

item.title: Afghanistan: Labour demands urgent action over evacuation crisis
item.description: People being beaten, shot at or raped while trying to secure documentation in Kabul, Lisa Nandy says.

item.title: Afghanistan: Boris Johnson says he has full confidence in Dominic Raab
item.description: The UK foreign secretary is facing calls to quit over his handling of evacuations.

item.title: Ex-MP Jared O'Mara charged with seven counts of fraud
item.description: Jared O'Mara is charged in relation to alleged fraudulent expenses claims, the CPS say.

item.title: Sheffield hotel fall: MPs call for urgent investigation after death
item.description: They are backing a review into refugee safety after Mohammed Munib Majeedi fell from a hotel window.

item.title: Government borrowing shrinks in July
item.description: Despite a fall, borrowing was still the second-highest on record for July as Covid spending continues.

item.title: Raab: With hindsight I wouldn't have gone on holiday
item.description: The foreign secretary says he was focused on Afghanistan, despite being abroad when Kabul fell.

item.title: Afghanistan evacuation: 'We'll use every remaining hour and day' - Raab
item.description: UK Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab gives an update on the evacuations from Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: G7 demands Taliban guarantee safe passage for evacuees, says PM
item.description: The G7 powers have agreed a roadmap for engaging with a Taliban government, says Boris Johnson.

item.title: Afghanistan: Jack Straw on UK-US political relations
item.description: The former foreign secretary says it takes a lot of work to influence US governments from outside.

item.title: Wallace: Extension to 31 August Afghanistan withdrawal deadline 'unlikely'
item.description: The UK defence secretary says "time is people" in the rush to evacuate those in danger.

item.title: Levelling up: The seaside town debating what change is needed
item.description: As a report says levelling up plans must consider local views, people in Rhyl debate the changes needed.

item.title: Afghanistan: Who originally supported Trump's deal with the Taliban?
item.description: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace now calls it a "rotten" deal but supported it at the time.

item.title: Sent to Halifax: One town's asylum story
item.description: What life is like for asylum seekers in a Yorkshire town - and what locals think about accepting more.

item.title: Woke: Compliment or criticism, it is now fuelling the culture wars
item.description: The surprising history of a term increasingly thrown around in UK political debate.

item.title: Afghanistan: Why can't the UK hold Kabul airport without the US?
item.description: The US and UK have different timetables for the effort to evacuate people from Afghanistan

item.title: Who is Dominic Raab?
item.description: A profile of the foreign secretary, as he comes under fire for his handling of the Afghanistan crisis.

item.title: Boris Johnson feels MPs' anger during Afghanistan debate
item.description: After a year of flat debates, a full Commons proved harder for the PM to navigate, writes Jessica Parker.

item.title: Biden on Afghanistan fact-checked
item.description: How consistent is President Biden in his comments on Afghanistan?

item.title: Afghanistan: How many asylum seekers has the UK taken in?
item.description: The UK government says it will resettle up to 20,000 Afghan refugees, but warns it will "take time".

item.title: Could Scots be guaranteed a minimum income?
item.description: The government is to start work on plans for an income guarantee scheme aimed at wiping out poverty in Scotland.

item.title: Afghanistan: What's the impact of Taliban's return on international order?
item.description: What is the diplomatic fallout and how allies and rivals are looking at the US following the Taliban takeover?

item.title: COP26: How serious is the government about climate conference?
item.description: With less than 90 days to go to Glasgow climate summit, there is uncertainty surrounding the event.

item.title: Ben Elliot: Conservative Party money man with A-list connections
item.description: Tory fundraiser and co-chairman Ben Elliot is at the centre of controversy over an elite donors club.

item.title: Berlin embassy arrest: A case of old-school spying?
item.description: Why nothing in the case of the arrest of a man at the British Embassy in Berlin should surprise us.

item.title: Boris Johnson: Why mining gaffe will linger after Scottish visit
item.description: Boris Johnson put his foot in it by joking that Margaret Thatcher gave the UK a "big early start" in the shift away from coal.

item.title: Riots 10 years on: The five summer nights when London burned
item.description: In August 2011 a man was shot dead by police in London, triggering the worst civil unrest in decades.

item.title: Indyref2: Why has the campaign for another vote gone quiet?
item.description: Boris Johnson visits Scotland with no sign an independence referendum will be soon, writes Nick Eardley.

item.title: Covid-19: Behind-the-scenes battles over amber watchlist
item.description: Cabinet divisions over international travel rules spilled out into the open this week, writes Adam Fleming.

item.title: Tragedy became Sliding Doors moment for politician
item.description: Julie James's life changed overnight when the father of her first child was killed in a car crash.

item.title: Guli Francis-Dehqani: The bishop tackling England's housing crisis
item.description: The Church of England owns a lot of land - Guli Francis-Dehqani wants to use it for the common good.
